alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 11:58PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Garvin, western Seminole, Cleveland, northwestern Pontotoc, Pottawatomie and McClain Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1157 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oklahoma City to near Etowah to near Paoli. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Shawnee, Newcastle, Seminole, Tecumseh, Pauls Valley, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Lexington, Pink, Goldsby, Stratford, Konawa, Maysville, Maud, Wayne, and Earlsboro. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 68 and 120. Interstate 40 between mile markers 174 and 199. Interstate 44 between mile markers 107 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
